intro: Oreoselinum, commonly known as the "oregano of the sea," is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in maritime climates. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory properties. Oreoselinum is also valued in culinary applications, particularly in Mediterranean cuisine.
